meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in or participates in ring games or sports.
meanings.sent1: The young ringster won the boxing match with his quick moves.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast is a talented ringster, excelling in various ring exercises.
meanings.sent3: The ringster showed off his skills in the wrestling match, making the audience cheer.
meanings.sent4: She was a true ringster on the basketball court, maneuvering around opponents effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The circus performer amazed everyone with her abilities as a ringster on the trapeze.

meanings.definition: A member of a group or organization that operates a ring or illegal scheme.
meanings.sent1: The authorities arrested the ringster involved in the illegal betting ring.
meanings.sent2: The undercover agent infiltrated the criminal organization as a ringster to gather evidence.
meanings.sent3: The cunning ringster devised a plan to deceive unsuspecting victims in the scam.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the mastermind ringster behind the fraudulent scheme that fooled many.
meanings.sent5: The notorious ringster was finally caught after years of running illegal operations.

meanings.definition: A person who is involved in or associated with a ring or circle of people.
meanings.sent1: As a social ringster, she was always at the center of gatherings and events.
meanings.sent2: The friendly ringster welcomed new members into the close-knit community.
meanings.sent3: The gossip-loving ringster was the first to know all the news within the group.
meanings.sent4: He was a loyal ringster, standing by his friends through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The charismatic ringster brought people together, creating a strong bond among them.
